engine.rendering

Class RenderContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • engine.rendering.RenderContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IRenderContext

    public class RenderContext
extends java.lang.Object
implements IRenderContext
    An implementation of higher-level rendering functions.
    Author:
    Benny Bobaganoosh (thebennybox@gmail.com)

      • drawSprite

        public void drawSprite(SpriteSheet sheet,
              int index,
              double startX,
              double startY,
              double endX,
              double endY,
              double transparency,
              boolean flipX,
              boolean flipY,
              Color color)
        Description copied from interface: IRenderContext
        Draws a sprite.
        Specified by:
        drawSprite in interface IRenderContext
        Parameters:
        sheet - The SpriteSheet containing the sprite
        index - The index of the sprite in the SpriteSheet.
        startX - The start location on X, normalized into the range (-1, 1)
        startY - The start location on Y, normalized into the range (-1, 1)
        endX - The end location on X, normalized into the range (-1, 1)
        endY - The end location on Y, normalized into the range (-1, 1)
        transparency - The amount of transparency the sprite should be drawn with.
        flipX - Whether the sprite is flipped on the x axis.
        flipY - Whether the sprite is flipped on the y axis.
        color - The color masking the sprite.

      • drawString

        public double drawString(java.lang.String str,
                SpriteSheet font,
                double x,
                double y,
                double scale,
                Color color,
                double wrapX)
        Description copied from interface: IRenderContext
        Draws a string.
        Specified by:
        drawString in interface IRenderContext
        Parameters:
        str - The string to draw
        font - The SpriteSheet containing the font being used.
        x - The start location on X, normalized into the range (-1, 1)
        y - The start location on Y, normalized into the range (-1, 1)
        scale - How large each character should be
        color - The color being used for the font
        wrapX - The point on x at which the text should wrap to the next line. -1 if no wrapping is desired.
        Returns:
        The y location that the next line of text should begin at.

      • clearLighting

        public void clearLighting(Color color)
        Description copied from interface: IRenderContext
        Clears all lighting to a specific color. Note that lighting is deferred until the applyLighting method is called.
        Specified by:
        clearLighting in interface IRenderContext
        Parameters:
        color - The color to clear to.

      • drawLight

        public void drawLight(LightMap light,
             double startX,
             double startY,
             double endX,
             double endY,
             double texStartX,
             double texStartY,
             double texEndX,
             double texEndY,
             Color color)
        Description copied from interface: IRenderContext
        Draws a light to the screen. Note that lighting is deferred until the applyLighting method is called.
        Specified by:
        drawLight in interface IRenderContext
        Parameters:
        light - The light to draw
        startX - The start location on X, normalized into the range (-1, 1)
        startY - The start location on Y, normalized into the range (-1, 1)
        endX - The end location on X, normalized into the range (-1, 1)
        endY - The end location on Y, normalized into the range (-1, 1)
        texStartX - The location in the LightMap on X where pixels should begin being copied, normalized into the range (0, 1)
        texStartY - The location in the LightMap on Y where pixels should begin being copied, normalized into the range (0, 1)
        texEndX - The location in the LightMap on X where pixels should finish being copied, normalized into the range (0, 1)
        texEndY - The location in the LightMap on Y where pixels should finish being copied, normalized into the range (0, 1)
        color - The color to mask the light with.

      • applyLighting

        public void applyLighting()
        Description copied from interface: IRenderContext
        Applies all accumulated lighting operations to whatever has currently been drawn. This function should typically be called after most rendering, but before text and GUI rendering, so that they are unaffected by lighting.
        Specified by:
        applyLighting in interface IRenderContext
